problem.401_2: {message} The link in your email may have expired, and a new email may have to be sent.

alert.success: An email has been sent to {email} with further instructions.

alert.create: Success! Automatic backups are now configured.
alert.terminate: Your automatic backups were terminated. I recommend you set up a new one as soon as possible.

problem.default: {message} Please try again, and go to the community forum if the problem continues.

FieldKeyNew.title: Create App User
FieldKeyNew.introduction: This user will not have access to any Forms at first. You will be able to assign Forms after the user is created.
success: The App User “{displayName}” has been created.

success.full: You can configure a mobile device for “{displayName}” right now by {scanningCode} into their app. Or you can do it later from the App Users table by clicking “See code.”
You may wish to visit this Project’s {formAccessSettings} to give this user access to Forms.

heading.full: App Users in this Project only will be able to download and use Forms within this Project. When you create a new App User, it will not have access to any Forms at first. To set the Forms each App User may access, use the {formAccess} tab. Multiple devices can use the same App User profile without problem. For more information, {clickHere}.

FieldKeyList.emptyTable: There are no App Users yet. You will need to create some to download Forms and submit data from your device.

alert.create: The App User “{displayName}” was created successfully.
alert.revoke: Access was revoked for the App User “{displayName}”.

FieldKeyRevoke.title: Revoke User Access
introduction: Are you sure you want to revoke access from the App User {displayName}?
Existing Submissions from this user will remain, but anybody relying on this user will have to create a new one to continue downloading Forms or uploading Submissions.

heading: Based on the Form you uploaded, the following files are expected. You can see which ones have been uploaded or are still missing.
To upload files, drag and drop one or more files onto the page.

problem.default: {message} No files were successfully uploaded. | {message} Only 1 of {total} files was successfully uploaded. | {message} Only {uploaded} of {total} files were successfully uploaded.

alert.success: 1 file has been successfully uploaded. | {localeN} files have been successfully uploaded.

introduction: Are you sure you want to upload {filename} as {attachmentName}?
We are double-checking because the filenames do not match.

duringDragover.dropToUpload: Drop now to upload this file as {attachmentName}.
duringDragover.dragover: Drag over the file entry you wish to replace with the file and drop to upload.

dropToPrepare.full: Drop now to prepare {countOfFiles} for upload to this Form.

full: {countOfFiles} has a name we don’t recognize and will be ignored. To upload it, rename it or drag it onto its target.
{countOfFiles} have a name we don’t recognize and will be ignored. To upload them, rename them or drag them individually onto their targets.

afterSelection.noneMatched: We don’t recognize the file you are trying to upload. Please rename it to match the names listed above, or drag it individually onto its target. | We don’t recognize any of the files you are trying to upload. Please rename them to match the names listed above, or drag them individually onto their targets.

duringUpload.total: Please wait, uploading your 1 file: | Please wait, uploading your {localeN} files:
duringUpload.remaining: This is the last file. | {localeN} files remain.

notUploaded.title: To upload files, drag and drop one or more files onto this page

introduction.full: To upload files, you can {dragAndDrop} one or more files onto the table on this page.
If you would rather select files from a prompt, ensure that their names match the ones in the table and then {clickHere}.

FormChecklist.clickForInfo: Click here to find out more.

steps.title: Publish your first Draft version
body: You have published your Form. It is ready to accept Submissions. If you want to make changes to the Form or its Media Files, you can make a new Draft.

steps.title: Download Form on survey clients and submit data
body: Nobody has submitted any data to this Form yet. | A total of 1 Submission has been sent to this server. | A total of {localeN} Submissions have been sent to this server.
App Users will be able to see this Form on their mobile device to download and fill out.

none: You have not created any App Users for this Project yet, so nobody will be able to use this Form.

none.full: You can create them on the {appUsersTab}.
none.appUsersTab: App Users tab of the Project page

full: Right now, {countOfAppUsers} in this Project has access to this Form, but you can always {addMore}.
Right now, {countOfAppUsers} in this Project have access to this Form, but you can always {addMore}.

steps.title: Evaluate and analyze submitted data
body: Once there is data for this Form, you can export or synchronize it to monitor and analyze the data for quality and results. | You can export or synchronize the 1 Submission on this Form to monitor and analyze them for quality and results. | You can export or synchronize the {localeN} Submissions on this Form to monitor and analyze them for quality and results.

body.full: You can do this with the Download and Analyze buttons on the {submissionsTab}.

As you come to the end of your data collection, you can use the Form State controls on the {formAccessTab} to control whether, for example, App Users will be able to see or create new Submissions to this Form.
body.formAccessTab: Form Access tab of the Project page

FormDelete.title: Delete Form
introduction: Are you sure you want to delete the Form {name} and all of its Submissions?

FormDraftChecklist.clickForInfo: Click here to find out more.

steps.title: Upload initial Form definition
body: Your Form design has been loaded successfully.

body.status: If you have made changes to the Form itself, including question text or logic rules, now is the time to upload the new XML or XLSForm using the button to the right.

link.full: If you have made changes to the Form itself, including question text or logic rules, now is the time to {upload} the new XML or XLSForm.

body.full: Your Form design references files that we need in order to present your Form. You can upload new or updated copies of these for distribution under the {mediaFiles} tab.

steps.title: Test the Form on your mobile device

body.full: It’s a good idea to test the Form to be sure it (still) works the way you expect. Using the {testQrCode}, you can make a test Submission that won’t affect your real data.

body.status: When you are sure your Draft is ready and you wish to roll it out to your devices in the field, you can publish it using the button to the right.

link.full: When you are sure your Draft is ready and you wish to roll it out to your devices in the field, you can {publish} it.

problem.409_6: The version name you’ve specified conflicts with a past version of this Form. Please change it to something new and try again.

alert.upload: Success! The new Form definition has been saved as your Draft.
alert.publish: Your Draft is now published. Any devices retrieving Forms for this Project will now receive the new Form definition and Media Files.
alert.abandon: The Draft version of this Form has been successfully deleted.

formNav.tabTitle: These functions will become available once you publish your Draft Form

FormList.title: Forms
FormList.emptyTable: There are no Forms to show.

alert.create: Your new Form “{name}” has been created as a Draft. Take a look at the checklist below, and when you feel it’s ready, you can publish the Form for use.

introduction.create: To create a Form, upload an XForms XML file or an XLSForm Excel file.
introduction.update: To update the Draft, upload an XForms XML file or an XLSForm Excel file.

introduction.full: If you don’t already have one, there are {tools} to help you design your Form.

introduction: If you have media, you will be able to upload that on the next page, after the Form has been created.

dropZone.full: Drop a file here, or {chooseOne} to upload.

problem.400_8: The Form definition you have uploaded does not appear to be for this Form. It has the wrong formId (expected “{expected}”, got “{actual}”).
problem.400_15: The XLSForm could not be converted: {error}
problem.409_3: A Form already exists in this Project with the Form ID of “{xmlFormId}”.

warningsText: This XLSForm file can be used, but it has the following possible problems (conversion warnings):
Please correct the problems and try again.

warningsText.create: If you are sure these problems can be ignored, click the button to create the Form anyway:
warningsText.update: If you are sure these problems can be ignored, click the button to update the Draft anyway:

none.title: No Current Draft
none.body: There is not currently a Draft version of this Form. If you want to make changes to the Form or its Media Files, start by creating a Draft using the button above.

FormOverviewRightNow.submissionsCaption: has been saved for this Form. | have been saved for this Form.

body.full: To set this Form’s state, please visit the Project {formAccessSettings}.

NotFound.title: Page Not Found
NotFound.body: The page you requested could not be found.

introduction.full: Projects group {forms} and {appUsers} together to make them easier to organize and manage, both on this website and on your data collection device.

body.full: If you’re not sure where to begin, we have a getting started guide and user documentation available on the {docsWebsite}.
In addition, you can always get help from others on the {forum}, where you can search for previous answers or ask one of your own.

rightNow.usersCaption: who can administer Projects through this website. | who can administer Projects through this website.
rightNow.projectsCaption: which can organize Forms and App Users for device deployment. | which can organize Forms and App Users for device deployment.

ProjectList.emptyTable: There are no Projects for you to see.

alert.create: Your new Project has been successfully created.

ProjectNew.title: Create Project
introduction: Projects group Forms and App Users together to make them easier to organize and manage, both on this website and on your data collection device.

ProjectOverviewAbout.title: About Projects
body: Any Forms you create in this Project will only be visible on data collection devices to App Users who are a part of this Project.

Future releases of ODK Central will add more Project-centric features, including improvements to Form states and workflow, device state updates, Collect settings management, and more granular permissioning.

body.full: For more information, please see {helpArticle}, and if you have any feedback please visit {forumThread}.

ProjectOverviewRightNow.appUsersCaption: who can use a data collection client to download and submit Form data to this Project. | who can use a data collection client to download and submit Form data to this Project.
ProjectOverviewRightNow.formsCaption: which can be downloaded and given as surveys on mobile clients. | which can be downloaded and given as surveys on mobile clients.

alert.unassignWithoutReassign: Something went wrong. “{displayName}” has been removed from the Project.
alert.assignRole: Success! “{displayName}” has been given a Role of “{roleName}” on this Project.
alert.unassignRole: Success! “{displayName}” has been removed from this Project.

alert.submitted: Your data download should begin soon. If you have been waiting and it has not started, please try again.

UserEditPassword.title: Change Password
UserEditPassword.cannotChange: Only the owner of the account may directly set their own password.

alert.mismatch: Please check that your new passwords match.
alert.success: Success! Your password has been updated.

heading: Web Users have accounts on this website to oversee and administer the Projects on this server. Administrators can manage anything on the site. Users with no role can still be made Project Managers on any Project, from that Project’s settings.

alert.create: A user was created successfully for “{displayName}”.
alert.assignRole: Success! “{displayName}” has been given a Sitewide Role of “{roleName}”.
alert.resetPassword: The password for “{displayName}” has been invalidated. An email has been sent to {email} with instructions on how to proceed.

UserNew.title: Create Web User
UserNew.introduction: Once you create this account, the email address you provide will be sent instructions on how to set a password and proceed.

introduction.full: Once you click {resetPassword} below, the password for the user “{displayName}” <{email}> will be immediately invalidated. An email will be sent to {email} with instructions on how to proceed.

UserRetire.title: Retiring User
introduction: You are about to retire the user account “{displayName}” <{email}>. They will be immediately barred from performing any actions and logged out.

introduction.full: {noUndo}, but a new account can always be created for that person with the same email address.

introduction: Are you sure you wish to proceed?

UserRow.cannotAssignRole: You may not edit your own Sitewide Role.

request.noRequest: Something went wrong: there was no request.
request.noResponse: Something went wrong: there was no response to your request.
request.errorNotProblem: Something went wrong: the server returned an invalid error.

router.unsavedChanges: Are you sure you want to leave this page? Your changes might not be saved.
